verses.verse: And if <S%H3588><s%> a soul <S%H5315><s%> sin, <S%H2398><s%> and hear <S%H8085><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of swearing, <S%H423><s%> and is a witness, <S%H5707><s%> whether <S%H176><s%> he has seen <S%H7200><s%> or <S%H176><s%> known <S%H3045><s%> of it; if <S%H518><s%> he do not utter <S%H5046><s%> it, then he shall bear <S%H5375><s%> his iniquity. <S%H5771><s%>

Or <S%H176><s%> if <S%H834><s%> a soul <S%H5315><s%> touch <S%H5060><s%> any <S%H3605><s%> unclean <S%H2931><s%> thing, <S%H1697><s%> whether <S%H176><s%> it be a carcass <S%H5038><s%> of an unclean <S%H2931><s%> beast, <S%H2416><s%> or <S%H176><s%> a carcass <S%H5038><s%> of unclean <S%H2931><s%> cattle, <S%H929><s%> or <S%H176><s%> the carcass <S%H5038><s%> of unclean <S%H2931><s%> creeping <S%H8318><s%> things, and if it be hidden <S%H5956><s%> from him; he also shall be unclean, <S%H2931><s%> and guilty. <S%H816><s%>

Or <S%H176><s%> if <S%H3588><s%> he touch <S%H5060><s%> the uncleanness <S%H2932><s%> of man, <S%H120><s%> whatever <S%H3605><s%> uncleanness <S%H2932><s%> it be that a man shall be defiled <S%H2930><s%> with, and it be hid <S%H5956><s%> from him; when he knows <S%H3045><s%> of it, then he shall be guilty. <S%H816><s%>

Or <S%H176><s%> if <S%H3588><s%> a soul <S%H5315><s%> swear, <S%H7650><s%> pronouncing <S%H981><s%> with his lips <S%H8193><s%> to do evil, <S%H7489><s%> or <S%H176><s%> to do good, <S%H3190><s%> whatever <S%H3605><s%> <S%H834><s%> it be that a man <S%H120><s%> shall pronounce <S%H981><s%> with an oath, <S%H7621><s%> and it be hid <S%H5956><s%> from him; when he knows <S%H3045><s%> of it, then he shall be guilty <S%H816><s%> in one <S%H259><s%> of these. <S%H428><s%>

And it shall be, when <S%H3588><s%> he shall be guilty <S%H816><s%> in one <S%H259><s%> of these <S%H428><s%> things, that he shall confess <S%H3034><s%> that he has sinned <S%H2398><s%> in that thing:

And he shall bring <S%H935><s%> his trespass <S%H817><s%> offering <S%H817><s%> to the LORD <S%H3068><s%> for his sin <S%H2403><s%> which <S%H834><s%> he has sinned, <S%H2398><s%> a female <S%H5347><s%> from the flock, <S%H6629><s%> a lamb <S%H3776><s%> or <S%H176><s%> a kid <S%H8166><s%> of the goats, <S%H5795><s%> for a sin <S%H2403><s%> offering; and the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall make an atonement <S%H3722><s%> for him concerning his sin. <S%H2403><s%>

And if <S%H518><s%> he be not able <S%H5060><s%> <S%H1767><s%> to bring <S%H5060><s%> a lamb, <S%H7716><s%> then he shall bring <S%H935><s%> for his trespass, <S%H817><s%> which <S%H834><s%> he has committed, <S%H2398><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> turtledoves, <S%H8449><s%> or <S%H176><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> young <S%H1121><s%> pigeons, <S%H3123><s%> to the LORD; <S%H3068><s%> one <S%H259><s%> for a sin <S%H2403><s%> offering, and the other <S%H259><s%> for a burnt <S%H5930><s%> offering.

And he shall bring <S%H935><s%> them to the priest, <S%H3548><s%> who shall offer <S%H7126><s%> that which <S%H834><s%> is for the sin <S%H2403><s%> offering first, <S%H7223><s%> and wring <S%H4454><s%> off his head <S%H7218><s%> from his neck, <S%H6203><s%> but shall not divide <S%H914><s%> it asunder:

And he shall sprinkle <S%H5137><s%> of the blood <S%H1818><s%> of the sin <S%H2403><s%> offering on the side <S%H7023><s%> of the altar; <S%H4196><s%> and the rest <S%H7604><s%> of the blood <S%H1818><s%> shall be wrung <S%H4680><s%> out at <S%H413><s%> the bottom <S%H3247><s%> of the altar: <S%H4196><s%> it is a sin <S%H2403><s%> offering.

And he shall offer <S%H6213><s%> the second <S%H8145><s%> for a burnt <S%H5930><s%> offering, according to the manner: <S%H4941><s%> and the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall make an atonement <S%H3722><s%> for him for his sin <S%H2403><s%> which <S%H834><s%> he has sinned, <S%H2398><s%> and it shall be forgiven <S%H5545><s%> him.

But if <S%H518><s%> he be not able <S%H5381><s%> to bring <S%H5381><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> turtledoves, <S%H8449><s%> or <S%H176><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> young <S%H1121><s%> pigeons, <S%H3123><s%> then he that sinned <S%H2398><s%> shall bring <S%H935><s%> for his offering <S%H7133><s%> the tenth <S%H6224><s%> part of an ephah <S%H374><s%> of fine flour <S%H5560><s%> for a sin <S%H2403><s%> offering; he shall put <S%H7760><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> oil <S%H8081><s%> on it, neither <S%H3808><s%> shall he put <S%H5414><s%> any frankincense <S%H3828><s%> thereon: <S%H5921><s%> for it is a sin <S%H2403><s%> offering.

Then shall he bring <S%H935><s%> it to the priest, <S%H3548><s%> and the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall take <S%H7061><s%> his handful <S%H4393><s%> <S%H7062><s%> of it, even <S%H853><s%> a memorial <S%H234><s%> thereof, and burn <S%H6999><s%> it on the altar, <S%H4196><s%> according <S%H5921><s%> to the offerings made by fire to the LORD: <S%H3068><s%> it is a sin <S%H2403><s%> offering.

And the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall make an atonement <S%H3722><s%> for him as touching <S%H5921><s%> his sin <S%H2403><s%> that he has sinned <S%H2398><s%> in one <S%H259><s%> of these, <S%H428><s%> and it shall be forgiven <S%H5545><s%> him: and the remnant shall be the priest's, <S%H3548><s%> as a meat offering. <S%H4503><s%>
And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> to Moses, <S%H4872><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%>

If <S%H3588><s%> a soul <S%H5315><s%> commit <S%H4603><s%> a trespass, <S%H4604><s%> and sin <S%H2398><s%> through ignorance, <S%H7684><s%> in the holy <S%H6944><s%> things of the LORD; <S%H3068><s%> then he shall bring <S%H935><s%> for his trespass <S%H817><s%> to the LORD <S%H3068><s%> a ram <S%H352><s%> without <S%H8549><s%> blemish <S%H8549><s%> out of the flocks, <S%H6629><s%> with your estimation <S%H6187><s%> by shekels <S%H8255><s%> of silver, <S%H3701><s%> after the shekel <S%H8255><s%> of the sanctuary, <S%H6944><s%> for a trespass <S%H817><s%> offering.

And he shall make amends <S%H7999><s%> for the harm <S%H2398><s%> that he has done in the holy <S%H6944><s%> thing, and shall add <S%H3254><s%> the fifth <S%H2549><s%> part thereto, <S%H5921><s%> and give <S%H5414><s%> it to the priest: <S%H3548><s%> and the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall make an atonement <S%H3722><s%> for him with the ram <S%H352><s%> of the trespass <S%H817><s%> offering, and it shall be forgiven <S%H5545><s%> him.

And if <S%H3588><s%> a soul <S%H5315><s%> sin, <S%H2398><s%> and commit <S%H6213><s%> any <S%H259><s%> of these things which <S%H834><s%> are forbidden <S%H3808><s%> to be done <S%H6213><s%> by the commandments <S%H4687><s%> of the LORD; <S%H3068><s%> though he knew <S%H3045><s%> it not, yet is he guilty, <S%H816><s%> and shall bear <S%H5375><s%> his iniquity. <S%H5771><s%>

And he shall bring <S%H935><s%> a ram <S%H352><s%> without <S%H8549><s%> blemish <S%H8549><s%> out of the flock, <S%H6629><s%> with your estimation, <S%H6187><s%> for a trespass <S%H817><s%> offering, to the priest: <S%H3548><s%> and the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall make an atonement <S%H3722><s%> for him concerning <S%H5921><s%> his ignorance <S%H7684><s%> wherein <S%H834><s%> he erred <S%H7683><s%> and knew <S%H3045><s%> it not, and it shall be forgiven <S%H5545><s%> him.
It is a trespass <S%H817><s%> offering: he has certainly trespassed <S%H816><s%> against the LORD. <S%H3068><s%>
